website_summaries.verdict: This is a low-cost roller stand with a smaller capacity than many competitors. For some, it will be all that's needed.
pros: Works with saws, jointers, and some other tools
Folds down flat for easy storage when not in use
cons: Adjusting the height can be tricky
Weight capacity is on the low side at 150 pounds

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these roller stands
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these roller stands. Three points - first, the plastic locking nut for the hight adjustment is very hard to get tight. A single arm handle would be preferable. Second, the feet need more robust floor-grabbing material (rubber, or other). These can slide if the material is heavy. Third, they just feel cheap and wobbly. Home Depot carries a roller stand for very close to this price and it's much more robust and feels like a quality stand. I have had no tip-over problems with them and the height adjustment holds. Are there better roller stands - yes. But in the $25 price range, I would not buy these Shop Fox stands.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not a good roller stand.
customer_reviews.text: I have to return it as the roller fell off and almost broke my toe. No feet so slides on floor. Do yourself a favor and don't buy this roller. Go to lowes and pick up the Kobalt roller stand for $20.
customer_reviews.author: Luke G

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but wish there were better mechanism to set the height.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, especially for the price, but the knob/screw you tighten to hold the height is a little bit cumbersome to use while trying to hold the roller at the height you want, tends to create permanent depressions in the shaft it's tightening on to and doesn't always hold that well. A lever actuated friction device like you find on tripods would be more practical.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinglow

customer_reviews.title: Love these roller stands!!!
customer_reviews.text: These roller stands are lifesavers! I've gotten more use out of them than I thought I would and now I'm finding that I use them in all situations. They're great for long pieces of lumber (or any other material for that matter). They're sturdy and easily adjustable. My only complaint would be that the little rubber things that are supposed to plug the square and rectangular "feet" come out easily. Bought two of these stands and I've already lost three of the rubber plugs. Otherwise this is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment - cheap adjustment, unstable
customer_reviews.text: The Shop Fox D2054 is poorly designed and cheaply made. The height adjustment knob doesn't work well to adjust the roller height (it's just a knurled knob on the end of a steel screw), and doesn't last (inferior-quality metal). Bad design! Also, the whole assembly is relatively unstable, unlike a number of other cheap (albeit slightly more expensive) roller stands on the market. Oh well, it was a $25x2 experiment gone wrong, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Stand is flimsy and likes to tip over
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and purchase one of the slightly more expensive stands from a different company. This stand is to light weight and likes to tip over. The base of the stand is way to narrow and unless weighted down will tip when used to support any longer material. Also after a few weeks of working outdoors (used to support 16' siding pieces when re-siding a house) the roller began to seize up and not spin freely.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: strudy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: very solid and useful. I use this all the time. I like that the roller is really heavy and the stand has a decent amount of weight to it as to not get pushed over when in use. Also, the height adjustment is not restricted to a pin and hole function instead you just tighten the hand screw to the exact height you need.
customer_reviews.author: Kauai 411

customer_reviews.title: One was fine. Would have been a 4 or 5 star ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these back a while. Finally getting to use them for a project cutting plywood on the table saw. One was fine. Would have been a 4 or 5 star review. The other one is junk. The base isn't flat. Both horizontal pieces are bowed, and they aren't hinged square. I have to shim it, and then it rocks. PIA. Price was good, but you get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: MrFishk

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more
customer_reviews.text: Okay stand, but for a few more dollars get one from Home Depot. This just isn't as sturdy, and sometimes the work piece will pull it along as you're feeding boards through a planer or saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: poor construction
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for in a roller stand, so I wasn't expecting these to be top of the line. But they aren't worth even this price. Primary complaint is what appears to be a complete disregard for any of the welds to be square with each other. Since there is no adjustment in the feet, nor the roller head, this is a critical flaw. The stand is unstable on any flat surface without using shims to level the feet. Remember the table at the diner that wobbled like hell every time someone touched it? There you go. Will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Akacrafstman

customer_reviews.title: Meh, get the one at Home Depot for $25
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but very cheap and flimsy, there is a cheaper one that is much better quality at HD, I'd recommend getting that one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Javad Shadzi

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: slightly light weight and you have to be sure to tighten the height pinch clamp down - but this is a good byuy for a portable and light weight roller stand!
customer_reviews.author: lefty

customer_reviews.title: Stand Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for with this stand. I find the stand very unstable. Bump it in any way and it will fold up and/or tip over. I'm going to buy a much heavier and hopefully more stable stand.
customer_reviews.author: Ron M

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Compromise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit because it folds up and is relatively compact. Unfortunately, those qualities afffect its stability. Overall, it does what I need for the infrequent times I need it. If I cut long stock more frequently, and if I had more room, I would purchase a stand with a more substantial fixed base. Better yet, build a bench that is long enough to handle the stock.
customer_reviews.author: jschirra

customer_reviews.title: A decent roller stand.  No real concerns.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The roller portion is a little bit smaller than expected, but sturdy and fits my needs just fine. A good price but I ended up finding cheaper ones that were just as good. But no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but not top- shelp.  Great for extra help when your good ones are not enough.
customer_reviews.text: They are inexpensive, and for the price, a fair deal. But cheaply made, and hard to firmly adjust by hand, requires vise grips to fix them at a solid height. I use them for back- up. These should not be the first one you add to your tools collection.
customer_reviews.author: JEJ

customer_reviews.title: it seems like it will fail at some point
customer_reviews.text: It ok, but I wish the height adjustment gave me a little more faith..it seems like it will fail at some point, but that may be just skeptical thought. I think its good for occasional use, or if it doesnt have to be moved and adjusted frequently
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Smith

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: We were working a TV shoot (hidden Money Makeover to air on the TLC network) and I had to basically move my shop tools to the shoot site. This roller was a great help. I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Rockaways Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Superb for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Solid and adjustable. The only complaint I had is that I needed to add non-skid material to the feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works nice for long cuts on my miter saw. Seems pretty sturdy, great price too
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I needed and the price was an excellent value. They are very substantial and adjust to a height I needed for the tile cutter I bought them for as well as for a chop saw I use them with.
customer_reviews.author: Amat Photog

customer_reviews.title: A tool all people with a chop saw should have
customer_reviews.text: This roller stand makes chopping long pieces of wood on a saw significantly more easy. Especially if your don't have a helper. It's made of steal, and feels pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Naylor

customer_reviews.title: These are a little cheap but work as expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a little cheap but work as expected. I don't see why you would need the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality and practical, best helper for the out-feed of my table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need one of these if you are going to rip long stock.
customer_reviews.text: This is essential if you are working alone on your table saw and you are using long stock; gotta have a place to slide your material once it goes through the saw; In my opinion, this is an important safety item for ripping long stock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my saws
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome addition to my tools. I recently used this to cut 3/4 particle board. It held the weight just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Fitzmaurice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Light and durable. I don't know how I went without this for so long. Will be purchasing more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Apollyon1339

customer_reviews.title: Excellent craftsmanship, I used them all the time
customer_reviews.text: Excellent craftsmanship, I used them all the time. easy to adjust and it can handle a lot of weight. I cannot believe I went this long with a set of this.. Amazing
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: it seems like a good stand and it was the cheapest one ...
customer_reviews.text: no issues here. it seems like a good stand and it was the cheapest one out there I could find.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Work great for tablesaw and planer
customer_reviews.text: Work great for tablesaw and planer. Sturdy, lightweight and easy to store. No scalping on lumber coming out of planer.
customer_reviews.author: vmax1

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Very cost effective solution. Does the job. Simple to assemble and operate. Doesn't take up much space. I'd order another one if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Something Purchased

customer_reviews.title: Fair quality roller stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an out-feed roller for my portable table saw. Nice quality for the price. I made the addition of adjustable feet so I could level it on my uneven brick driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Gary

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It does the job, but not as well as a higher priced stand. The height doesn't go too high and the set screw loosens. The welds are sloppy too. Typical from China.
customer_reviews.author: Clemuel.

customer_reviews.title: Great work stands
customer_reviews.text: I have used homemade versions of this stand for years, constructed out of wood with a metal roller. These are far superior. Very light, easily adjusted, and they roll smoothly. I like how they fold for easy transport when I've got a project away from home. I've lately been using them to support 16' baseboard and crown molding for mitering and coping. I use two: one on either side of my miter saw or both on one side, depending on the length of the work. They would also work well for table saw outfeed of long work. I should have purchased these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: The Dirt Guy

customer_reviews.title: Ok but will tip over
customer_reviews.text: Work ok, but you have to be very careful as they do easily tip over and move.
customer_reviews.author: Dew

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for helping feed long pieces through my tablesaw
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for helping feed long pieces through my tablesaw. Only reason I gave four instead of five is that it will tip over sideways if you aren't careful. I should have bought two at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: John L. Hellmann Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for the price. Sometimes will snag when rolling angle iron or other steel over it. Not bad overall.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Miller

customer_reviews.title: Only drawback I can see is that it needs some type of locking device to keep it from folding up so easily at inappropriate
customer_reviews.text: Should have had one of these years ago. Only drawback I can see is that it needs some type of locking device to keep it from folding up so easily at inappropriate times
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: What a great product for the money, very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Don Miles

customer_reviews.title: A real bargain. Works perfectly. I can't believe ...
customer_reviews.text: A real bargain. Works perfectly. I can't believe how much confidence I have gained on my portable table saw with this thing. I wish I had bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: This is a get what you pay for roller stand.
customer_reviews.text: This is a get what you pay for roller stand. For $20, it held the end of the boards I cut just fine. I threw it into the garage, and will use it again someday. Even if I have to weld it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: has side to side play but great for holding up things
customer_reviews.author: Junior King

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, flaky paint
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic but works well for the price. The paint is pretty crappy, so I dinged it a star. The threaded nut was what drew me to this stand as it seems to be a more robust design (than the cam types). I've used it with my table and miter saws. My main use was with longer boards.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: This product is excellent and is a very well built tool
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent and is a very well built tool. The packaging and shipping was great and I would highly recommend this product,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool Stand, bro.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job it should do. Had a few issues with it falling over, but where it was was not a level surface, so I'm not sure I can blame that on the stand itself.
customer_reviews.author: orepy9

customer_reviews.title: not the best stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: not the best stand for the money. home depots hdx rollar stand is $1 more and is much more slide resistand.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Roll On !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the Quality, Performance and Value of this item. I would not hesitate to recommend it to a friend,
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good equipoment at a great price! Adjusts easily and rolls smoothly despite being covered repeatedly in sawdust!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Handy time saving product that makes handling long boards safely.. I should have bought two. Not as solid as I would have liked but it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Easy simple tool that makes so much of a difference ...
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long! Easy simple tool that makes so much of a difference in the shop. This stand is sturdy, inexpensive and very adjustable. Great design. Plan to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent for the price. Use it with my table saw and jointer
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kordsmeier

customer_reviews.title: after some modification= perfection
customer_reviews.text: after welding some additional gussets on it planning on buying another one I have added some reinforcement and also repainted it with bed liner
customer_reviews.author: Kiai

customer_reviews.title: Not super stable. But for the price I can't complain
customer_reviews.text: Not super stable. But for the price I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: I. Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Solidly constructed roller
customer_reviews.text: Good solidly constructed roller. Lots of use and never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Gee

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable
customer_reviews.text: It's not as stable as other roller stands I have. If you look at the pictures, the tube ends are just normal cap inserts that do not extend past the metal tubes. I would have paid an extra $10 for something with rubber tube inserts that extend past the metal tubing so there is extra grip and stability.
customer_reviews.author: Casey S.

customer_reviews.title: when the wife can't come out and help...
customer_reviews.text: Performs adequately for straight-trough stock, though not for side-sliding stock. Not as good as my wife, bit she can't always come out and help.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Drury

customer_reviews.title: It works wonderfully and is very easy to move and reposition
customer_reviews.text: I used this item today while processing some 12 foot boards with my miter saw. It works wonderfully and is very easy to move and reposition. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: oscar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great and at a fraction of the cost of others similar
customer_reviews.author: Obi Wan

customer_reviews.title: a quarter turn lever world be better.
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should, but it feels cheaper than I expected. Not a fan of the knob, a quarter turn lever world be better .
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and adjust, easy to store and after greasing the roller it does not squeak any more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Good Roller Stand
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust and a great addition to my table saw.
customer_reviews.author: David Chenoweth

customer_reviews.title: It probably would have been a much better design to orient the feet parallel to how a ...
customer_reviews.text: It works most of the time, but it's a little unstable and I've knocked it over with wood before. It probably would have been a much better design to orient the feet parallel to how a board rolls across it instead of perpendicular, in the same way classic shop bents are built.
customer_reviews.author: T. S.

customer_reviews.title: works perfect
customer_reviews.text: what is not to like. it works perfect and the price in perfect
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Decent affordable extension stand for a table saw.
customer_reviews.text: This stand works very well with my Dewalt table saw and stand. It is a bit touchy on setting the elevation but I would buy more.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome roller
customer_reviews.text: Simple and great , does what it intended to do and can't beat the price .
customer_reviews.author: kacper

customer_reviews.title: Really useful, works exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these. Really useful, works exactly as described, very easy to setup and or move. Buy a few to keep in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen S. Brand

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simple product, the paint is peeling off on arrival though so dinged a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough quality for the money, but not amazing. Buy only if you can't afford a more expensive stand.
customer_reviews.author: Shrimp

customer_reviews.title: Good little helpers
customer_reviews.text: I use these with my table saw and many other projects. I like that they collapse down and fit under the table. The rollers are smooth and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jasaj

customer_reviews.title: Really great buy
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't believe what others are asking for their roller stands. While back I bought one local at a tool sale and it was China junk!
customer_reviews.author: tls

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Was tired of make-shift outboard devices such as milk crates and boxes.

customer_reviews.title: not much to say. They stand up and they ...
customer_reviews.text: not much to say. They stand up and they roll.
customer_reviews.author: MrMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Broken welds.
customer_reviews.text: Broken weld on arrival. JB weld did the trick and seems sturdy enough now.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: good item
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust (which I can't say for my other one) and is a good price too. I'd buy another if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together and work great, pretty heavy duty too.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight adjustable supports
customer_reviews.text: I often find myself cutting long pieces of molding or strips of wood and sometimes don't have anyone to help support it. So I bought a couple of these roller supports and problem solved. They are sturdy, light weight, easily adjustable and they fold flat for storage. The roller supports the material and lets you easily slide it to adjust the cut. I don't cut anything really heavy so have not had any problem with weight capacity, but it appears to be capable of holding pretty heavy stock. Bottom line up front, this works for me in my shop!!
customer_reviews.author: RayH

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to the shop
customer_reviews.text: This has really come in handy when sawing long pieces of lumber. Good addition to the shop.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the money
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for my shop. It's pretty basic, but does a good job of holding long pieces of wood. It also has adjustable height which is good. My only complaint is that the roller does not spin very well. It probably just needs to be broken in or greased up a bit. Overall though, it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: wstewart

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Not likely to support the 150# spec
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Not likely to support the 150# spec. Tubing not thick enough. Not stable on the floor. Height adjuster wont hold. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned the item due to being to difficult to operate and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Gonefishin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: A little wobbly but compared to others this is a steal at the price.
customer_reviews.author: MYK

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money on something else
customer_reviews.text: These aren't great, they tip easily and don't roll well. They lack a mechanism to lock the legs open and will collapse when you're either pushing or pulling material across them.
customer_reviews.author: wasd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality stand. Very mobile and easy to setup and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Fabien J.

customer_reviews.title: There is better quality out there
customer_reviews.text: The stands work, but are flimsy and very tippy. There is better quality out there. We wish we would have just bought another HDX Home Depot brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Junk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, cheap junk, very flimsy and there are no "non-marring " pads included. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. Schott

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this 2 stars is that it only cost about $25. The chrome plating on the roller was blistering and coming off because the manufacturer applied it right over a rusty surface. This product will probably survive home use, but it's definitely not going to cut it in the workplace. The Chinese get away with this poor quality because American companies don't mind importing and selling this stuff to other Americans. There's a well-known term that needs to be revived in our country: Quality Control.
customer_reviews.author: Elmore Crouch

customer_reviews.title: One weak weld ruins the whole thing
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except for the ability to tighten up the height adjustment knob. The height is maintained by a bolt that can be tightened into the side of the shaft. The threads for this are provided by a nut welded over the hole. However, the weld is very weak and the nut pops off if tightened too much. The height adjustment feature is pretty important to a roller stand? I had ordered two and they both had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine. Rolls good
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Rolls good, moves easy, stores easy. Used to help rip a good 50lb piece of oak into strips to make a coffee table top. If you don't like it you're to picky
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Richard Heitzman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product. Super helpful, easy to set up. Sturdy. Used 2x4's and 3/4"plywood on it
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tavares

customer_reviews.title: Only problem is I only bought 1 and as I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is I only bought 1 and as I'm a DIYer with little help from the wife I need more support.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Murray

customer_reviews.title: Shop Fox Roller Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built, high quality Roller Stand. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: These roller stands are easy to tip without additional base support
customer_reviews.text: These roller stands are easy to tip without additional base support. Lock down screws do not hold well and are prone to slipping. Good construction, except screws, and easy to store and setup
customer_reviews.author: Nick B

customer_reviews.title: disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: the roller is not true!! how does anyone expect to do quality woodworking with the plank going up and down by 1/8" when rolling on that stand???!!? I had bought a 5 roller stand from Shop Fox that was OK ( not great) at least the rollers were true and well secured. This on the other side is borderline with insulting the customer. I will avoid Shop Fox from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Awful !
customer_reviews.text: Low quality, no foot pads makes the stand slide across the floor, unstable, tips over on full height extension, plastic end caps come off really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tyg

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: takes up very little space and works good. a nice 2nd hand for long boards on my chop saw or table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Roller Stand
customer_reviews.text: Love it . Light weight and easy to bring into any job site . Just the right tool for the job .
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great Roller Stand
customer_reviews.text: As they say, you get what you pay for. In short, this is a fantastic roller stand for the price! If you have $200 burning in your pocket, go purchase the fanciest stand you can find. But if you only need something to hold up the other end of the piece of wood, look no further. It's actually well built and does the job well for the money. (I purchased mine from the scratch and dent section of Amazon, but it was in perfect condition upon arrival.)
customer_reviews.author: JohnC12

customer_reviews.title: Poor stand
customer_reviews.text: Legs were not welded square so it is a teeter totter
customer_reviews.author: James P. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Like having that third hand
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it works. I use it on the drill press, the miter saw, ban saw, table saw. It does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mark_C

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a few weeks and the weld which holds the adjustment knob broke off. Its only tack welded. Got it re-welded and its a good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Mac

product_meta.title: Shop Fox D2054 Roller Stand
product_meta.description:
Adjustable work-support is constructed for heavy-duty use! Adjusts in height from 24-1/2-Inch to 42-Inch. Unique design provides superior stability

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Adjustable work-support is constructed for heavy-duty use! Adjusts in height from 24-1/2-Inch to 42-Inch. Unique design provides superior stability
